result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amy Bogust appears via phone.  Victims parents appear in person and do not wish to make any statements at this time.  Atty. Severson requests preliminary hearing.  Ct. hears from ADA Johnson, Atty. from Channel 3000 requesting copy of complaint

11:30 AM Defendant Cal D. Dorota appeared in court, Attorney Brian William Severson appeared in court for Cal D. Dorota, Attorney Curtis E Johnson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record of current case status - amended motion filed.  Court makes disclosure on possible conflict - no party requests recusal at this time.  Atty Severson addresses Court with basis of his motion.  Court hears form ADA Johnson in response.  Atty Severson gives response.  Victim's mother gives statement.   Court makes findings and gives basis to deny motion.  Court dismisses PTAC enhancer in Count 1.  State requests $1000 signature bond:  no contact with victim, victim's parents and their residence.  Atty Severson requests the Court to conduct the initial appearance now.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of complaint.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.
